greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of partitions of n with k parts in which no part occurs more than 3 times (n>=1, k>=1).
comment: Row n has floor(sqrt(6n+6)-3/2) terms. Row sums yield A001935. Sum(k*T(n,k),k>=0) = A117148(n).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..350, flattened
maple: g:=-1+product(1+t*x^j+t^2*x^(2*j)+t^3*x^(3*j),j=1..35): gser:=simplify(series(g,x=0,23)): for n from 1 to 18 do P[n]:=sort(coeff(gser,x^n)) od: for n from 1 to 18 do seq(coeff(P[n],t^j),j=1..floor(sqrt(6*n+6)-3/2)) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
b:= proc(n, i) option remember; local j; if n=0 then 1
elif i<1 then 0 else []; for j from 0 to min(3, n/i) do
mathematica: max = 18; g = -1+Product[1+t*x^j+t^2*x^(2j)+t^3*x^(3j), {j, 1, max}]; t[n_, k_] := SeriesCoefficient[g, {x, 0, n}, {t, 0, k}]; Table[DeleteCases[Table[t[n, k], {k, 1, n}], 0], {n, 1, max}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 08 2014 *)
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Mar 07 2006
